frameDefinitions: A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.

A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs.
An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. '' 'The government froze settlement construction in 1992 to facilitate peace talks.'
frameExamples: The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
That they got the same answers is just a <t>coincidence</t>.
The government <t>froze</t> settlement construction in 1992 to facilitate peace talks.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> for which an <fen>Agent</fen> is pausing.
An <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which an <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an <fen>Agent</fen> pauses in the course of an <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
Is it a coincidence <fex>that most of the planets fall within the Titius-Bode law's boundaries</fex>?
<fex>Last night's</fex> coincidences were too much for me to handle.
Several strange coincidences <fex>at the airport</fex> got the attention of federal officials.
